attributes.action: The hospitality sector needs urgent government action to survive coronavirus
attributes.additional_details:
We are already seeing 25-45% drops in footfall and sales, which will only get worse now the advice is to stay away from pubs, clubs and social gatherings.

Hospitality is a cash business, the intangibility means if we don’t sell a seat or bed today, it can’t be sold tomorrow.

If something doesn’t happen there will be closures & massive job losses within the 3.2m people employed in our sector.

We are the heartbeat of the nation. People will need us more than ever once this is over.
attributes.background:
We need the government to follow UK Hospitality’s advice & provide the following support;

o Immediately suspending business rates payments for all hospitality businesses for this year

o Extending SSP coverage to hospitality businesses of all size

o Short-terms subsidies of staff wages
